teal.sim.engine

Interface TEngineControl

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TEngine, TSimEngine
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EMEngine, EngineControl, SimEngine

    public interface TEngineControl
    EngineControl objects are the primary means through which the application, and its user, control the model. EngineControl object. The SimEngineControl instance of the latter is architectured to contain the thread object within which the model runs. As such, it can directly initialize, start, step, stop and reset the simulation. A note about model states and model control methods. These two concepts should not be confused. The control methods modify the model state, but only do so conditionally on the current state, as well as other factors. They also do other instance and architecture specific changes, such as reset other model variables.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ENDED
      Model state value, where the simulation has ended, this differs from PAUSED in the sense that the simulation IS NOT allowed to return to the RUNNING state.
      static int INIT
      Model state value, where the simulation is initialized, but no actual simulation has yet happened, in other words the model has not yet started, stopped or ended, that is has not yet been in any of the RUNNING, PAUSED or ENDED states respectively.
      static int NOT
      Model state value, where the simulation is not yet initialized.
      static int PAUSED
      Model state value, where the simulation is stopped, this differs from ENDED in the sense that the simulation IS allowed to restart, that is return to the RUNNING state.
      static int RUNNING
      Model state value, where the simulation is running continuously, referred to alternatively as the simulation being started.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void end()
      suspends the ability to start or step the world, the only action at this state is spatial updates and reset.
      int getSimState()
      returns the current state of the model.
      void init()
      Initializing the model puts it in the INIT state, and insures that it is ready to start, by performing preliminary The method Initialized the model, by insuring that it is ready to start.
      void not()
      Stops the engine if running and sets status to not initialized.
      void reset()
      Stops the world, resets time and frame count to zero, and makes sure the workd is ready to run.
      void resume()
      resumes running at the current world state
      void setSimState(int state)
      This is provided for propertyChange support normally should not be called from the application.
      void start()
      Starts repeated calls to next step.
      void step()
      Stops or inits the world and then call a single nextStep().
      void stop()
      Stops the model at its current state processing of spatial changes continues.

    • Field Detail

      • NOT

        static final int NOT
        Model state value, where the simulation is not yet initialized.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INIT

        static final int INIT
        Model state value, where the simulation is initialized, but no actual simulation has yet happened, in other words the model has not yet started, stopped or ended, that is has not yet been in any of the RUNNING, PAUSED or ENDED states respectively. The exception being that the model reverts to this state when state the model reverts to when it is reset.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RUNNING

        static final int RUNNING
        Model state value, where the simulation is running continuously, referred to alternatively as the simulation being started.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAUSED

        static final int PAUSED
        Model state value, where the simulation is stopped, this differs from ENDED in the sense that the simulation IS allowed to restart, that is return to the RUNNING state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENDED

        static final int ENDED
        Model state value, where the simulation has ended, this differs from PAUSED in the sense that the simulation IS NOT allowed to return to the RUNNING state. However, the simulation may be reset, that is revert to the INIT state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • not

        void not()
        Stops the engine if running and sets status to not initialized. No actions should be performed except init when the engine is in this state.

      • init

        void init()
        Initializing the model puts it in the INIT state, and insures that it is ready to start, by performing preliminary The method Initialized the model, by insuring that it is ready to start.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the model at its current state processing of spatial changes continues.

      • end

        void end()
        suspends the ability to start or step the world, the only action at this state is spatial updates and reset.

      • start

        void start()
        Starts repeated calls to next step.

      • step

        void step()
        Stops or inits the world and then call a single nextStep().

      • resume

        void resume()
        resumes running at the current world state

      • reset

        void reset()
        Stops the world, resets time and frame count to zero, and makes sure the workd is ready to run.

      • getSimState

        int getSimState()
        returns the current state of the model.

      • setSimState

        void setSimState(int state)
        This is provided for propertyChange support normally should not be called from the application.
